definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
life (as the characteristic of living beings)/living being/creature/CL:個|个[ge4],條|条[tiao2]
to give a name to/to dub/to christen/to designate/named after/naming
mission/long-term task to which one devotes oneself/a calling
to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
proposition (logic, math.)/to assign an essay topic
to save sb's life/(interj.) Help!/Save me!

sentences.english: Palmer knows that Drazen is holding Kimberly and wants him dead.
sentences.chinese: 帕默知道德拉赞一伙捉住了金姆，并且想要他的命。

sentences.english: I'm feeling goose bumps now. I was having death threats, I never felt safe for 3 and a half years.
sentences.chinese: 有人恐吓说要我的命，那三年半我没有一点儿安全感。

sentences.english: Loudly in cases of life of the people on board the boating shore, let the police check.
sentences.chinese: 继宗高声命船上的人把船泊岸，让警察上船检查。
及时的一根针救了九条命？

sentences.english: And Marchisio similar can be said of today's armed forces Yongming Juventus.
sentences.chinese: 与马尔基西奥类似，今天的尤文图斯可谓三军用命。

sentences.english: Madam, it's not worth to take risk, your life is precious.
sentences.chinese: 夫人，划不来嘛，你的命很值钱的。

sentences.english: Take the horse and the cart, you devil, only don't take my life.
sentences.chinese: 马和车都归你，你个魔鬼，只要留下我的命。

sentences.english: The fortunes of a house depend entirely on its master.
sentences.chinese: 家中百事兴，全靠主人命。

sentences.english: A cat has nine lives. But the AZRAEL still take it away.
sentences.chinese: 猫有九条命，但它仍然会被死神带走。

sentences.english: Therefore doth my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.
sentences.chinese: 我父爱我，因我将命舍去，好再取回来。

sentences.english: You saved my life, I am forever in your debt.
sentences.chinese: 你救我了的命，我永运感激不尽。

sentences.english: Fixating on a single enemy at the expense of everything else is likely to get you flanked and killed.
sentences.chinese: 只盯着一个敌人而不顾其他可能会要你的命。

sentences.english: Eg ; Believe it or not , the tree has killed many people .
sentences.chinese: 信不信由你这颗树已经要了很多人的命。

sentences.english: B: Oh, How terrible for Tom. I’m so sorry.
sentences.chinese: 噢，汤姆命太苦了，我真难过。

sentences.english: Only the king could save his life.
sentences.chinese: 只有国王才能救他的命。

sentences.english: My heart thumps fast. My wrist is hurting. Wes is killing me.
sentences.chinese: 我心跳加快，手腕很疼，维斯简直是在要我的命啊。

definition: to follow orders/to abide by/to obey
glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
to lose one's life/to get killed
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
